interactive_description: For the sixth consecutive year, the Austin region posted the fastest population growth in the nation for metro areas with more than 1 million people, according to U.S. Census Bureau annual estimates.
story_title: Census: Austin metro hits 2 million mark again, this time for real

interactive_title: Texas transforms: A demographic deep dive
interactive_description: The Census Bureau released detailed demographic data about Texas counties, including age, gender, race and ethnicity. Explore how the the population of our state and counties have changed over time, from 2010 to 2015.
story_title: Jobs, schools bring growing Asian population north

interactive_description: A glance across our skyline or a drive up MoPac (good luck with that!) is all we need to see that Central Texas is growing like a playful Labrador puppy. But March 2016 U.S. Census Bureau statistics confirmed what those big puppy paws told us would happen: We're growing awfully fast.
story_title: Austin metro area surpasses 2 million residents

interactive_description: Census estimates for 2014 show the Austin area is still growing faster than any other major city, as it has been every year since 2010. Also, the influx of people moving into the five-county area centered around Austin is accelerating.
story_title: Austin metro area posts high growth again — but some ask, at what cost?

interactive_title: Central Texas cities lead nation in growth
interactive_description: San Marcos, Georgetown and Cedar Park are in the top 10 of fastest-growing cities with more than 50,000 people from 2012-2013.
story_title: Why San Marcos is the nation's fastest-growing city

interactive_description: We compare income distribution in select Central Texas cities, using U.S. Census survey data from 2007-09 and 2010-12.
story_title: As Austin and most suburbs grow, so does poverty

interactive_description: A look at how income distribution changed in Central Texas counties from 2008 to 2012.
story_title: Despite signs economy is rebounding, Austin metro area poverty rate doesn't fall

interactive_description: The Austin-Round Rock area has led percentage of growth among all metro areas of 1 million population or more since 2010, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
story_title: Austin, by the numbers, is continuing to boom, census data shows

interactive_description: Austin ranks 9th nationally in the percentage increase of commuter-adjusted population vs. resident population, when considering cities greater than 500,000 residents.
story_title: Austin’s population swells with commuters during the day
